result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole M Belongia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation to run concurrent with any other probation currently being served.

miscConds.notes: Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts by 05-23-22, or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office.

AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent. 
Mental Health Examination

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole M Belongia

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicole M Belongia in court.  Attorney Adam J Snavely in court for Nicole M Belongia.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty. Count 1 - Guilty. Court accepts plea and orders 7 months imposed and stayed sentence with 2 years probation. Conditions of probation , AODA , mental health assessment, any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent. DNA sample and surcharge, court costs and fine in the amount of $518.00 paid within 60 days to the clerk of courts or set up payment plan.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was appointed counsel but they did not appear. Court has date on calendar for March 24th. bond continued

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicole M Belongia appeared by video without counsel. Attorney Karl Peter Hayes appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney rights given. Defendant waives right to an attorney. Court finds the Defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving the right to an Attorney. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty plea entered by court.  Bond continued. Court sets pre -trial for March 24th at 9:30 am.
